summary: The provided documents do not contain any information about Jack Smith. Instead, they focus on the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The documents detail Sentinella's involvement, including electronic surveillance, alleged communist connections, and the FBI's operational policies during these investigations. There is no mention of Jack Smith or any connection to the JFK assassination in these documents.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Jack Smith has no significance in the JFK context.
